text: I'll put up an issue for it for the new UI that will be under settings

Hi! Is there a way to fetch the unique module ID from inside the module? We used to do that with `{{ parent_custom_widget_name }}`, however this is returning an empty value when deployed in the new IDE. Is there an alternative that will work from now on?

Thanks!
You can use `{{ name }}` now

is it just me or are these super generic variable names starting to worry anyone else?

For example the new design manager using “css_class” which caused issues with custom modules which used that variable - I had to edit around 10 modules to deal with that change.

“name” is about as generic as can be, I can see anyone’s modules for say a staff listing page or things like that getting screwed up.

Not saying that you guys can’t change the variable names, by all means if there’s something better go for it, but this went from about as specific as it can be `{{ parent_custom_widget_name }}` to simply `{{name}}` If we’re going to shorten them can the bulk of HubSpot variables be prefixed `hs_VARIABLENAME`
Any update on when the HS site search is coming out of beta? Google’s site search page states that it’s scheduled to be taken down on Apr. 1

if you’re not wanting to use the site search while it’s still in beta, we’ve found sitesearch360 to be a great solution for our clients. (inexpensive, and has more features than the HS site search currently has)

Note: HS Search does feel pretty stable based on what I’ve seen, though I haven’t tried anything too crazy with it.
You can sign up for beta here: <https://designers.HubSpot.com/content-search-beta>
<@U7SL518D6> I agree with the namespace idea. Sounds great in my humble opinion

not really feedback so I’m putting this here instead of the DM2 feedback channel: I was wondering how everyone has been organizing their files in the new design manager. I personally have been creating a root folder and kinda mimicing the old structure but having separate folders for JS CSS and custom module dependencies. I want to know what others are doing, because maybe there’s a better philosophy on it?
We're still experimenting with it

Here is the full list of variables set in the module. 
portal_id
is_live
module (also available as widget for backwards compatibility)
name
module_id
language
request
messages
js_assets
css_assets
other_assets

the old custom modules had 
portal_id
is_live
widget
custom_widget_name
parent_custom_widget_name
seems like solid info that should get added to  <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/modules/reference>
will do
Hey <@U7SL518D6> here is how we've decided to structure folders in the new DM2.

is there any existing documentation for what is_live and  messages do? my guess is is_live would toggle whether the module displays in the listing of modules on a site or something.

and messages I’m not sure what that could be.
Would love others feedback. We built this based off the fact that we build for the marketplace but seemed to work well in general for clients and stuff too.
A file, which can't be shown because your team is past the free storage limit, was commented on.
Thanks!
The only thing we found is it looks deep when you go to create a page
<@U26C29XPH> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/U26C29XPH/F9XUDPAKH/screen_shot_2018-03-27_at_8.46.49_am.png|Screen Shot 2018-03-27 at 8.46.49 AM.png>
interesting hadn’t even really thought about how it looks in the template selector when creating a page

I'd be curious to know from HubSpot's side if they have data showing whether people even use this folder drop down when creating pages or do users just scroll or search for the template they want. Then it might be a mute point.
I think this is a great idea, but using name without a prefix in ones own code seems like a general mistake to begin with
I'd also say css_class is a mistake -- class is a reserved word, most languages use css_class or cssClass as the language var for css class --
valid points.
I'D ALSO LIKE TO MENTION IT WOULD BE GREAT IF EVERYTHIGN WAS HS_
sorry for caps
caps was appropriate imho lol
A file, which can't be shown because your team is past the free storage limit, was commented on.

Thanks Chris, I just submitted a request for our company’s portal. We do have some clients who aren’t on DM 2.0 yet so I’ll also check out sitesearch360 for another solution - Thanks for that, Jon
i dont recomend that now. enterprise its no really for that, we had multiple problems trying to do it and if we can go back in time, we will choose separate HS accounts
